title: Something to Sing About (Musical, 1937) James Cagney, Evelyn Daw | Movie

sources.title: Something to Sing About (Musical, 1937) James Cagney, Evelyn Daw | Movie
sources.description:
Dancing...Romancing and Packing a Real Wallop!
A New York bandleader journeys to Hollywood when he is offered a contract with a studio, but he is determined to do things his way and not theirs.

Original title: Something to Sing About (1937) AKA: Hollywood Hollywood

Colorized version https://youtu.be/3dI_cWxSDus


This film is available with subtitles in many languages.
Director: Victor Schertzinger
Writers: Victor Schertzinger, Austin Parker
Stars: James Cagney, Evelyn Daw, William Frawley
Genres: Classics, Comedy, Musical


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)
01:57 A glimpse into the Hollywood scene in the 1930s through a farewell party for Terry Rooney.
11:54 Struggles of a hoofer turned actor in Hollywood under the guidance of a demanding director.
17:41 Glimpse into the Hollywood film industry in 1937, showcasing the dynamics between actors, directors, and studio executives.
23:17 A glimpse into the drama and action behind the scenes of a Hollywood film in 1937.
32:47 A chaotic search for a missing star leads to unexpected revelations and a dramatic turn of events in Hollywood.
42:00 Celebrity chaos ensues as Terry Rooney's unexpected fame leads to a whirlwind of events in San Francisco and Hollywood.
49:48 A Hollywood actor faces a dilemma when his contract forbids marriage, prompting a creative solution.
53:08 Gossip and romance unfold on a Hollywood set, leading to unexpected love interests and behind-the-scenes drama.
1:01:01 Drama unfolds as a Hollywood actor refuses to attend an opening night, causing tension with his manager.
1:03:23 Drama unfolds as Rita returns from a trip, leading to misunderstandings and plans for a vacation in Hollywood.
1:12:20 Drama unfolds as a Hollywood actor's secret marriage is revealed, causing chaos on set.
1:20:42 Famous singer Mrs. Terry Rooney faces a last-minute performance opportunity at Palomino Roof amidst chaos and drama.


@CultCinemaClassics
